comment: I've never been a fan of blended whiskey but this is very good stuff. I'm also a big fan of whiskey with an age statement but the XO is Nas. I tried this on a recommendation of a friend. I was pleasantly suprised. It will definitely have a place in my liquor cabinet.
Finishes with the taste of cognac.
Excellent maple taste and texture. The nutmeg is unmistakable, with a refreshingly mild mint finish.

One thing Crown has always been is the benchmark for a "spiced" smooth whiskey if from north of the border,, as far back as I can remember(over 40 years) we always looked at CR as the special SPICEYwhiskey you could count on for a great drink and not make you vomit from some syrupy additive.
      
      The folks at Crown Royal have made their cognac cask finish whiskey a dram that lives up to the name in a distinctly spicey but honest flavor, the fact this bottle is often found at the same price as "old blue bags" itself,,  given its fine drinking it could easily take a spot in anybodies DAILY drinker row. 
      
      Great CR traditional taste with the always smooth and easy finish you expect and a hint of congac notes just to add some fun to life.  Its just slightly better Crown  at the same price as standard so this one gets 4.6 stars for being a magnificent value.
      
      If you don't like  Crown Royals already nice spicey flavor w/ a tad more complexity and  always smooth finish then go drink some "fiarball" swill and leave the good stuff to those with the good sense to appreciate it!
3.5. Smoother than the generic batch but still sweet and mild
just not my thing, a little watery and not a compelling flavor profile
very sweet, smooth. good for Canadian
caramel, brown sugar, vanilla, coconut, and, bananas. My first experience with Crown Royal and one I will not forget.
One of my all time favorites. Worth every penny you'll pay.
I love crown royal, especially in cocktails. However is a great supper or for cocktails! Incredibly smooth, with the perfect blend of fruit flavors from the cognac aging!

2nd purchased bottle.   Worth it to keep it in stock. 
Update: After refining my palate, this is ok.  I  am not a big fan of the Canadian whiskys.
Was sweet and smooth. Very good.
It has the sweet, fruit, and enough spice to smooth out the whisky. This is good stuff.

Lite body, fruity. 
This is a very easy drinking dram. But if you are used to more fuller body whisk(e)ys the ethanol might be too much. As it really dominates the finish.
Its an okay easy drinking whiskey. A bottle to share for sure.

it's overly sweet and the actual whiskey taste is masked with a floral and waxy covering. it taste like crown Royal dropped a cube of lard in each bottle. With all that I can at least say I have a moderately expensive cooking whiskey now.
Boy this is as good as the reserve, to close to call 😋

This was a great find at the liquor store. Slightly sweeter and more complex than regular Crown Royal, but very smooth and sip-able. I like the notes that the sherry aging added, and I especially like how this blend isn’t overpowered by the barrels it is aged in
So sweet and smooth. Beautiful amber color. You definitely get tropical fruit notes. Almost tastes like it’s finished in rum barrels. Big fan.

Color is a dark Amber. Nose is initially a little heavy on ethanol. As the ethanol clears, notes of very dry fruit, mild oak, and subtle vanilla appear. First sip is smooth, slightly oily, with notes of toffee and vanilla most prominent. With additional sips the dry fruit from the nose starts to show Finishes with subtle baking spices, primarily nutmeg, that combine with the dried fruit. Overall, the flavor is fine, and more sophisticated than classic Crown Royal, but probably not worth the price difference, particularly with the higher proof Crown Royal Black available at a lower price point.
Very mild. Almost tasteless compared to other whiskeys I have been trying. It would be a good mellow starter whiskey.
Crisp earthiness with cognac finish. Slightly Smokey
Smooth, sweet, rich, vanilla tasteful Crown Royal recipe with whiskey oak and subtle cognac overtones
